definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: 13 consider well her ramparts, view her citadels, that you may tell of them to the next generation.
sentences.chinese: 細看他的外郭，察看他的宮殿，爲要傳說到後代。

sentences.english: His policy of overseas contacts was generally followed by his successors in Ming Dyn …
sentences.chinese: 明朝後代基本上沿用了太祖的海外交往政策。

sentences.english: Wolves and dogs can interbreed and produce offspring.
sentences.chinese: 狼和狗能夠異種交配而且繁育後代。

sentences.english: Living beings don’t create life, they re-purpose existing matter into offspring.
sentences.chinese: 衆生不創造生命，他們用現有的東西重新繁衍後代。

sentences.english: Remember, we ourselves are descendants of immigrants too.
sentences.chinese: 不要忘記，我們也是移民的後代。

sentences.english: Rabbit Garden Imperial Book Repository should obtain the descendant scholars' enough attention.
sentences.chinese: 敦煌本《兔園策府》應該得到後代學者的足夠重視。

sentences.english: We've got series of of top-class quality progeny from him.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經得到了一系列的一流品質的後代，從他的。

sentences.english: The coast is populated largely by Miskito Indians and descendants of African slaves.
sentences.chinese: 沿岸住滿了大量的米斯基託原住民和黑奴的後代。

sentences.english: This is especially true of any programming art in its second or later generation.
sentences.chinese: 這對於任何編程技術的第二代及更後代尤爲正確。

sentences.english: In this case, prolongation of life should trump reproduction.
sentences.chinese: 既然這樣，延長壽命就要重於繁衍後代。

sentences.english: They are more reproductively successful than unpaired females.
sentences.chinese: 和未配對的雌性相比，她們更能成功繁衍後代。

sentences.english: Do what Sarah says, because you shall have descendants through Isaac.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你要靠以撒來繁衍後代。

sentences.english: It doesn’t care if you get laid or remain a virgin.
sentences.chinese: 它也不關心你是否有後代或者仍是純潔的。

sentences.english: Parents give their children lucky money in red envelopes.
sentences.chinese: 後代疏給他們的小孩兒搭著黑包的壓歲錢。

sentences.english: It begets at least seven standard type offspring from such matings.
sentences.chinese: 這類交配中生下至少七個標準型後代。

sentences.english: The Caesar's Legion is comprised mostly of reconditioned tribals and their descendants.
sentences.chinese: 凱撒軍團主要由被其征服的部落以及他們的後代組成。

definition: to inherit/to succeed to (the throne etc)/to carry on (a tradition etc)
to carry on one's ancestral line
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
adoption (e.g. of a nephew as a son)/to inherit
huge/great/grand/worthy of the greatest admiration/important (contribution etc)
